title: Between Sinners And Saints
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GtbB7a

by ruxian

Tony never thought he’d be back on Earth again. Never thought he’d see his precious Pepper and Rhodey again, or the Avengers together ever again.

He thought he’d be doomed to die in that ship, to suffocate and starve to death next to Nebula in a last ditch attempt to get home.

But the universe was never that kind, was it?

Words: , Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, Gen
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Nebula (Marvel), Pepper Potts, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Scott Lang, Clint Barton, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Bruce Banner, Harley Keener, Peter Parker (mentioned), Happy Hogan, May Parker (Spider-Man), Thor (Marvel), Carol Danvers
  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, James “Rhodey” Rhodes & Tony Stark, Steve Rogers & Tony Stark, Clint Barton & Tony Stark, Nebula & Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Harley Keener & Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Angst, Hurt/Comfort, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - PTSD, Post-Avengers: Infinity War Part 1 (Movie), Healing, Conflict Resolution, Speculation, Pre-Avengers: Endgame (Movie), Recovery, Injury Recovery

summary:
°•Arguments With Tony Stark•°
Though Tony is a snarky, full of sass individual who loves to tease with his dry sense of humor he...
body:
°•Arguments With Tony Stark•°

  • Though Tony is a snarky, full of sass individual who loves to tease with his dry sense of humor he in truth hates fighting.
  • It’s just not his style, and he never actively seeks out arguing with anyone really, especially you, his s/o.
  • He might unintentionally make you upset sometimes with the things he says, or by taking a joke too far, but let’s be real here…
  • Tony hates conflict.
  • Like, say you do something to peeve him off he probably won’t even talk to you about it.
  • Instead, he’ll just let it simmer inside of him, and mull it over for a few hours until he’s no longer angry at you.
  • And, because Tony himself knows what a handful he is he often let’s a lot of little, everyday things that you might do slide.
  • Because, he gets it. He gets having quirks, and personal ticks, and it’s pretty easy for him to cool off.
  • If you do something that actually gets to him, he’ll just give you the silent treatment for a few hours.
  • Tony will just retreat away into the comfy solace of his workshop, and kill some time by tinkering away with his projects.
  • You’ll have to make the first move, and go down to see him first.
  • In which you’ll say sorry, and Tony will just pull you into a hug, and let your little spat go.
  • Even if he’s still slightly mad he loves you too much to get into a big fuss about it.
  • Now, let’s reverse it here.
  • Say, he did something to really annoy you now.
  • Be prepared for a lot of money to now be spent on you.
  • It’s hard for Tony himself to say the words “I’m sorry”.
  • So, instead he’ll let his actions speak for him.
  • When he truly knows he’s definitely made you mad, and has really screwed up big time he will do anything to make you happy again.
  • Private jet to Paris to dine on top of the Eiffel Tower? Done.
  • Trip to Tiffany’s in New York to buy you glittery diamonds? Yep.
  • Movie night with just the two of you, and he fetches your favorite pizza himself in his Iron Man suit? Of course.
  • Become your personal slave for the day, and dote on you endlessly? Uh-huh.
  • He’ll even wear a Maids outfit if it tickles your fancy.
  • Bottom line is you two don’t argue often.
  • But, when you do it’s bad. Really bad.
  • Especially if it’s about safety. Whether it be his, or yours.
  • Being caught up in heroes, and villains, and constant life threatening fights usually makes for some intense arguments.
  • But, it’s mostly because you both care about each other deeply, and don’t want the other getting hurt.
  • Basically, Tony is a big softie when it comes to you, and he hates it whenever you two aren’t 100% lovebirds.

body:
Stony & Stucky “we’re just friends”

After watching Carol and her friend *coughs*wife*coughs* Maria with whom she raised a child and whom she shared a home and was one of the 2 people she remembers after the memory blank…I think I finally understand why Steve and Tony and also Steve and Bucky still talk about being “friends”…they think it’s code for in a relationship that we don’t want the public to know about…

summary: Peter Parker dies in Endgame, or Tony Stark dies in Endgame. Your choice.
question: Peter Parker dies in Endgame, or Tony Stark dies in Endgame. Your choice.
answer:
Thanks for asking! ^o^

Hands down Peter Parker. I don’t… I liked Homecoming the first time I watched it but rewatching it showed me I didn’t like it that much and it’s not a movie I’m going to rewatch again, I barely look forward to Far From Home which does not look overwhelming at all. Tom Holland is doing a good job, but I have little attachment to MCU!Peter beyond the IronDad and SpiderSon dynamic.

Personally, I think Spider-Man is a hero who 100% works better in the cartoons - one thing all live-action movies are direly missing is the snarky voice-over commentary and considering Deadpool did it, I don’t understand why they never seem to consider doing it for live-action Peter? But until they do, I’ll prefer my Spider-Man animated.

Tony Stark however? Iron Man is one of the few live-action movies I actually have rewatched repeatedly, I would make a blood sacrifice for an Iron Man 4. And even if not, if him not dying means he can at the very least continue making cameos in movies? Like, an Ironheart movie where he mentors Riri Williams into taking over the franchise? Holy shit that would be the best thing ever.

So, if I have to chose one of them to continue existing in this franchise, I’d rather have Tony! ;)

Personally, I think Spider-Man is a hero who 100% works better in the cartoons - one thing all live-action movies are direly missing is the snarky voice-over commentary and considering Deadpool did it, I don’t understand why they never seem to consider doing it for live-action Peter? But until they do, I’ll prefer my Spider-Man animated.

Tony Stark however? Iron Man is one of the few live-action movies I actually have rewatched repeatedly, I would make a blood sacrifice for an Iron Man 4. And even if not, if him not dying means he can at the very least continue making cameos in movies? Like, an Ironheart movie where he mentors Riri Williams into taking over the franchise? Holy shit that would be the best thing ever.

So, if I have to chose one of them to continue existing in this franchise, I’d rather have Tony! ;)
trail.content:
Thanks for asking! ^o^

Hands down Peter Parker. I don’t… I liked Homecoming the first time I watched it but rewatching it showed me I didn’t like it that much and it’s not a movie I’m going to rewatch again, I barely look forward to Far From Home which does not look overwhelming at all. Tom Holland is doing a good job, but I have little attachment to MCU!Peter beyond the IronDad and SpiderSon dynamic.

Personally, I think Spider-Man is a hero who 100% works better in the cartoons - one thing all live-action movies are direly missing is the snarky voice-over commentary and considering Deadpool did it, I don’t understand why they never seem to consider doing it for live-action Peter? But until they do, I’ll prefer my Spider-Man animated.

Tony Stark however? Iron Man is one of the few live-action movies I actually have rewatched repeatedly, I would make a blood sacrifice for an Iron Man 4. And even if not, if him not dying means he can at the very least continue making cameos in movies? Like, an Ironheart movie where he mentors Riri Williams into taking over the franchise? Holy shit that would be the best thing ever.

So, if I have to chose one of them to continue existing in this franchise, I’d rather have Tony! ;)

summary: Service Dogs for Superheroes (SDfSH): Thanksgiving Dinner
title: Service Dogs for Superheroes (SDfSH): Thanksgiving Dinner
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2IBcbkM

by literally_no_idea

Thanksgiving dinner is a bit of a struggle; they’ve got 32 people coming, but only 16 places at the table, so Tony builds a square table that they put in the living room, moving the couches and other furniture to use as seats around the table, and they decide that half of them will sit at the “kids’ table,” as Tony dubs it.

Words: 2402, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

summary: when all of this is over
title: when all of this is over
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2VX2yRv

by nohalfway

“You’re such an idiot,” Tony says, rolling over and propping himself on Steve’s chest.

“I missed you,” he says, simply, as if that justifies sneaking into a country where he’s considered a war criminal, the same country he’d sworn to protect, just to spend the night. Except it’s much more than that. It’s worth it, every time.

Words: 1262, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of when all of this is over

summary: Like A Row Of Captured Ghosts
title: Like A Row Of Captured Ghosts
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2XnlN6H

by lizwillstealyourgirl

He shuts his eyes and counts, prays for a different nightmare to take him away, so that he never has to feel so hopeful and hopeless all at the same time, over and over again. He wants it to be real, he wants nothing more, but he knows it isn’t, how can it be? Weeks, maybe months have passed in empty rooms full of lies; how can Uncle Rhodey really be here? He can’t be — can he?

“Peter, buddy, Uncle Rhodey’s here—” No, no he isn’t, don’t lie to me— “he’s gonna get us out, okay? We’re gonna get out of here—” Stop fucking lying to me— “and we’ll go home, okay? We’re going home.” Peter shakes his head. Don’t let them win. None of it’s real. Don’t let them win.

—

Peter gets kidnapped. He doesn’t know what’s real anymore.

Words: 4113, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Tony Stark

  • Additional Tags: Mentioned May Parker (Spider-Man) - Freeform, James “Rhodey” Rhodes & Tony Stark Friendship, Mentioned James “Rhodey” Rhodes - Freeform, Kidnapping, Psychological Torture, Implied/Referenced Torture, Non-Graphic Violence, or maybe it’s graphic?, idk what constitutes as graphic violence, Violence, as a general thing, Waterboarding, Mind Games, Peter Parker Needs a Hug, Poor Peter Parker, Peter says Fuck, Angst, Hopeful Ending, it’s not….happy per say, Nightmares, Hallucinations, Dreams vs. Reality, Suicidal Thoughts, Abstract, Songfic
